Elements that are not inherently focusable should not have a tabindex applied to them outside of very specific use cases."\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Avoid using the autofocus attribute.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "avoid-autofocus",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "2.4.3 Focus Order",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/navigation-mechanisms-focus-order.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": " People who are blind or who have low vision may be disoriented when focus is moved without their permission. Additionally, autofocus can be problematic for people with motor control disabilities, as it may create extra work for them to navigate out from the autofocused area and to other locations on the page/view."\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Allow extending session timeouts.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "extend-timeouts",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "2.2.1 Timing Adjustable",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/time-limits-required-behaviors.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "If you cannot remove session timeouts altogether, then let the person using your site easily turn off, adjust, or extend their session well before it ends."\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Remove title attribute tooltips.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "remove-title-attribute",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "4.1.2 Name, Role, Value",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/ensure-compat-rsv.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "The title attribute has numerous issues, and should not be used if the information provided is important for all people to access. An acceptable use for the title attribute would be labeling an iframe element to indicate what content it contains."\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t]\n\t},\n\t"keyboard": {\n\t\t"preface": "It is important that your interface and content can be operated, and navigated by use of a keyboard. Some people cannot use a mouse, or may be using other assistive technologies that may not allow for hovering or precise clicking.",\n\t\t"tasks": [\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Make sure there is a visible focus style for interactive elements that are navigated to via keyboard input.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "visible-focus-style",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "2.4.7 Focus Visible",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/navigation-mechanisms-focus-visible.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "Can a person navigating with a keyboard, switch, voice control, or screen reader see where they currently are on the page?"\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Check to see that keyboard focus order matches the visual layout.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "focus-matches-layout",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "1.3.2 Meaningful Sequence",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/content-structure-separation-sequence.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "Can a person navigating with a keyboard or screen reader move around the page in a predictable way?"\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Remove invisible focusable elements.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "remove-invisible-focusable-elements",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "2.4.3 Focus Order",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/navigation-mechanisms-focus-order.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "Remove the ability to focus on elements that are not presently meant to be discoverable. This includes things like inactive drop down menus, off screen navigations, or modals."\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t]\n\t},\n\t"images": {\n\t\t"preface": "Images are a very common part of most websites. Help make sure they can be enjoyed by all.",\n\t\t"tasks": [\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Make sure that all img elements have an alt attribute.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "use-alt-attributes",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "1.1.1 Non-text Content",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/text-equiv-all.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "alt attributes (alt text) give a description of an image for people who may not be able to view them. They are incredibly important for helping people who use assistive technology to understand the meaning of a page or view.",\n\t\t"tasks": [\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Use heading elements to introduce content.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "use-heading-elements",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "2.4.6 Headings or Labels",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/navigation-mechanisms-descriptive.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "Heading elements construct a document outline, and should not be used for purely visual design."\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Use only one h1 element per page or view.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "use-only-one-h1",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "2.4.6 Headings or Labels",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/navigation-mechanisms-descriptive.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "The h1 element should be used to communicate the high-level purpose of the page or view. Do not use the h1 element for a heading that does not change between pages or views (for example, the site\'s name)."\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Heading elements should be written in a logical sequence.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "logical-heading-sequence",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "2.4.6 Headings or Labels",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/navigation-mechanisms-descriptive.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "The order of heading elements should descend, based on the “depth” of the content. If heading levels are being skipped for a specific visual treatment, use CSS classes instead."\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t]\n\t},\n\t"lists": {\n\t\t"preface": "Lists elements let people know a collection of items are related and if they are sequential, and how many items are present in the list grouping.",\n\t\t"tasks": [\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Use list elements (ol, ul, and dl elements) for list content.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "use-list-elements",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "1.3.1 Info and Relationships",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/content-structure-separation-programmatic.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "This may include sections of related content, items visually displayed in a grid-like layout, or sibling a elements."\n\t\t\t}\n\t\t]\n\t},\n\t"controls": {\n\t\t"preface": "Controls are interactive elements such as links and buttons that let a person navigate to a destination or perform an action.",\n\t\t"tasks": [\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Use the a element for links.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "use-links",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "1.3.1 Info and Relationships",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/content-structure-separation-programmatic.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "Links should always have a href attribute, even when used in Single Page Applications (SPAs). Without a href attribute, the link will not be properly exposed to assistive technology. An example of this would be a link that uses an onclick event, in place of a href attribute. "\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Ensure that links are recognizable as links.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "recognizable-links",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "1.4.1 Use of Color",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/visual-audio-contrast-without-color.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "Color alone is not sufficient to indicate the presence of a link. Underlines are a popular and commonly-understood way to communicate the presence of link content."\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Ensure that controls have :focus states.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "form-focus-states",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "2.4.7 Focus Visible",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/navigation-mechanisms-focus-visible.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "Visible focus styles help people determine which interactive element has keyboard focus. This lets them know that they can perform actions like activating a button or navigating to a link\'s destination."\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Use the button element for buttons.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "use-button-element",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "1.3.1 Info and Relationships",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/content-structure-separation-programmatic.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "Buttons are used to submit data or perform an on-screen action which does not shift keyboard focus. You can add type=\\"button\\" to a button element to prevent the browser from attempting to submit form information when activated."\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Provide a skip link and make sure that it is visible when focused.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "provide-skip-link",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "2.4.1 Bypass Blocks",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/navigation-mechanisms-skip.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "A skip link can be used to provide quick access to the main content of a page or view. This allows a person to easily bypass globally repeated content such as a website\'s primary navigation, or persistent search widget."\n\t\t\t},\n\t\t\t{\n\t\t\t\t"title": "Identify links that open in a new tab or window.",\n\t\t\t\t"checkboxId": "identify-new-window",\n\t\t\t\t"wcag": "G201: Giving users advanced warning when opening a new window",\n\t\t\t\t"url": "https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/G201.html",\n\t\t\t\t"description": "Ideally, avoid links that open in a new tab or window.
